result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek A Lamb

records.addlTxt:
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
No contact with S.P.

2:00 PM Defendant Derek A Lamb appeared by video.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Derek A Lamb.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.

Atty Bergner informs the court that his client did not have transportation and provided the ZOOM information for him to appear by video.
Court questions the defendant.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Court questions the defendant if he wishes to have a PreTrial Conference or a Preliminary Hearing.
Atty Bergner would like to set for a preliminary hearing.
Atty Bergner states that his client is a Wood County resident and would ask that the Pretrial Supervision Day Reporting be removed.

BY THE COURT:  Bond amended.
Pretrial Supervision Day Reporting be removed.
Atty Bergner to have his client sign and return the amended bond within 10 days
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:06 PM Defendant Derek A Lamb not in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Derek A Lamb.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant had spoke with the Clerk of Court Office informing of reason as to why he cannot come in for today's hearing.
Atty Bergner has not yet received the message.
Court informs Atty Bergner that his client is in violation of JusticePoint programming.

BY THE COURT: 
Initial Appearance adjourned.
Bond Continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Bergner.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 09/12/22 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 2
**DEFENDANT HAS REFUSED TO SIGN THE $2,000 SIGNATURE BOND**

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
No contact with S.P.
Participate in the Portage County Day Report Program and comply with the requirements for assessment and reporting.

1:35 PM Defendant Derek A Lamb appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of WI. 

Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Possession with intent to deliver Methamphetamine and Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Court sets a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
